title: What I actually enjoy about MLOps
preview: People think MLOps is just YAML and sadness. For me, it’s where models meet reality...
content:
People often treat MLOps as “just wiring things together”, but that’s exactly the part I enjoy.

I like:
• taking a messy notebook and turning it into a repeatable pipeline,
• making sure metrics don’t silently drift,
• and giving models enough logging so future-me can actually debug.

Good MLOps feels like being a translator between research and production: you speak both.

title: Tiny rules for training pipelines
preview: A few boring-sounding habits that have saved me hours of debugging later...
content:
Some small rules I try to follow when building training code:

1. Always log data shapes and a couple of example batches.
2. Keep config in one place (YAML or JSON), not scattered across scripts.
3. Save the exact commit hash + hyperparams with every trained model.
4. Treat data preprocessing as a versioned, testable component.

None of these are fancy, but they compound over time.
